title: England v France cancelled as Typhoon Hagibis hits Rugby World Cup - but Scotland-Japan to go ahead
text:
Rugby World Cup organisers have taken the unprecedented step of cancelling England’s game against France in Yokohama on Saturday with Typhoon Hagibis about to wreak havoc across Tokyo with as expected winds top 160mph.

Even though the Pool C match is one of the keynote fixtures of the group stage organisers stated that they had little option but to abandon the match given the safety of teams as well as spectators travelling to the game, with with meteorologists giving the storm the highest possible rating of ‘violent.’

“After extensive evaluation as result of predicated impact of the typhoon has led regrettably to the cancellation of matches involving England against France as well New Zealand...
description: Rugby World Cup organisers have taken the unprecedented step of cancelling England’s game against France in Yokohama on Saturday with Typhoon Hagibis about to wreak havoc across Tokyo with as expected winds top 160mph.
